intro: Rhexia virginica var. septemnervia, commonly known as the seven-veined purple coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, lavender-pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has opposite, lance-shaped leaves with seven distinct veins. Its floral structure consists of both ray and disk flowers, typical of the Asteraceae family. The species is notable for its ornamental value and its role in supporting local pollinators.
